document: Software Evolution and Maintenance - Chapter 4: Reengineering by Tripathy & Naik

questions.question: Reengineering involves the examination, analysis, and restructuring of an existing software system to reconstitute it in a new form.
The primary goal of reengineering is to ignore existing software system artifacts like specifications and design.
One of the general objectives of reengineering is to improve maintainability.
Migrating to a new technology is not considered an objective of software reengineering.
Abstraction and refinement are key concepts used in software reengineering.
Abstraction helps maintenance personnel reduce complexity by focusing on significant information and hiding irrelevant details.
Refinement is the process of increasing the level of abstraction of a system representation.
Forward engineering is the downward movement from the highest level of abstraction to the lowest level of implementation.
Reverse engineering involves an upward movement through the layers of abstractions.
Decompilation is an example of forward engineering where high-level program code is translated into object code.
The four levels of abstraction and refinement are Conceptual, Requirements, Design, and Implementation.
The reengineering process produces the code of the renovated system as an output.
Translating a program from BASIC to C is an example of a reengineering process.
The model proposed by Eric J. Byrne suggests that reengineering consists of reverse engineering, re-design, and forward engineering.
The Horseshoe model was developed by Kazman et al. to describe a three-step architectural reengineering process.
In the Horseshoe model, the left side represents Architecture Based Development.
Rehosting involves adding new features to the transformed targeted source code.
Rehosting is effective when a user is satisfied with the system's functionality but wants better execution efficiency.
Syntactic analysis and Program Slicing are techniques used for reverse engineering.
Data reverse engineering includes the extraction and conceptualization of data structures.
